hook.text: Fighter pilot John Boyd won every dogfight in under 40 seconds. His secret was a thinking loop.

buildup.text: OODA stands for Observe, Orient, Decide, Act. Speed through the loop beats raw firepower.

discovery.text: The key is Orient: updating your mental model faster than the situation changes.

twist.text: Most people get stuck at Observe, gathering data endlessly. Boyd said: decide and move.

climax.text: In business crises, the leader who cycles through OODA fastest sets the tempo.

punchline.text: Speed of decision beats quality of data.

quiz.question: What does the OODA loop prioritize?
options: Cycling through decisions faster than the situation changes
Gathering all possible data before acting
Waiting for consensus before making a move
